source.description:
Thaw samples on ice if necessary and briefly vortex. Centrifuge the samples at 1000xg for 2 minutes to pellet solid debris. Alternatively, when completely thawed, samples can be left on ice for 30 minutes. Solid debris should be visible at the bottom of the tube.
or

SAMPLES PREPARATION FOR INCUBATION IN A HEAT BLOCK OR WATER BATH
Transfer 100 μL of the sample Input Material (or clarified supernatant if working with fresh saliva) to a new microcentrifuge tube (1.5 mL capacity) containing an equal volume of lysis buffer (e.g. for 100 μL of sample add 100 μL of lysis buffer). Mix the obtained solution a few times by pipetting up and down. Label the tube with sample ID and other relevant information.
Lock the microcentrifuge lid using a lid lock (alternatively, an Eppendorf Safe-Lock tube can be used) to prevent tubes from popping open when exposed to high temperature.

Set the temperature of a heat block or water bath at 95°C. When the temperature has reached 95°C, place the tubes in
the heat block or water bath and incubate for 5 minutes.

Carefully transfer the tubes to ice or a 4°C Cold Block for 30 sec, or let sit at room temperature for 5 min.
Or

Centrifuge for 5 sec at 2000xg to spin down any condensation.
Samples are ready for the RT-LAMP Reaction. Proceed to Step 26.

source.specifications: Any standard mini centrifuge with adapters for different tube sizes will suffice
source.name: Mini-centrifuge

source.description:
If using a 96 well Thermal Cycler and following the Quick Method (Without Purification / Concentration)
Transfer 20ul of the sample input material (or clarified supernatant if Fresh Saliva) to a new 200ul tube containing an equal volume of 20ul of Lysis Buffer and pipette mix. Label this tube to indicate the sample name.

Create a Method on the Thermal Cycler for 95°C for 5 min followed by a Hold at 4°C, with the lid set to 105°C.
Hold at

source.specifications: Any standard PCR thermocycler will suffice
source.name: SimpliAmp Thermal Cycler

source.description: Place the tubes in the Thermal Cycler and run the method
Centrifuge for 3 sec at 2000xg to spin down any condensation.

source.specifications: Any standard mini centrifuge with adapters for different tube sizes will suffice
source.name: Mini-centrifuge

source.description: Preheat the Heat Block or Water Bath
Vortex to mix the Binding Solution so there is no sediment.
To each sample tube, add 800ul of Binding Solution

Let the Tubes sit at Room Temperature for 10 min, every 2 min invert the tube to suspend the Binding Solution.
at

Centrifuge for 3 sec at 2000xg to pellet the Binding Reagent in the Binding Solution Note: it should appear as a white smear at the bottom of the tube. The Binding Reagent should adhere to the bottom of the tube with a short spin on a simple benchtop centrifuge. Depending on tube type and input sample viscosity, a longer spin may be required until it is sufficiently pelleted.

source.specifications: Any standard mini centrifuge with adapters for different tube sizes will suffice
source.name: Mini-centrifuge

source.description: Remove the supernatant with a 1ml Pipette taking care not to disturb the pellet.
Add 1ml of Wash Solution, wash the pellet by closing and inverting the tube several times.
Centrifuge for 3 sec at 2000xg to pellet the Binding Reagent in the Binding Solution

source.specifications: Any standard mini centrifuge with adapters for different tube sizes will suffice
source.name: Mini-centrifuge

source.description: Remove the supernatant with a 1ml Pipette taking care not to disturb the pellet.
Centrifuge for 3 sec at 2000xg to collect any residual Wash Solution.

source.specifications: Any standard mini centrifuge with adapters for different tube sizes will suffice
source.name: Mini-centrifuge

source.description: Remove the residual supernatant with a 200ul Pipette taking care not to disturb the pellet.

Air dry in a clean ventilated area until the Binding Reagent is dry, it should appear opaque and not reflective, air drying should take 10-15 min, some sample types may take longer to dry, do not let drying take longer than 30 min. Note:If the lab is equipped, air drying should take place in a ventilated air cabinet to prevent cross contamination. To speed up the air drying, if available it is possible to use a Centrifuge with open tube lids, or a heated vacuum concentrator. If using these it would take less than 15 minutes as it should be evaporating less than 5-10ul of Wash Solution.

To each tube add 10ul of Resuspension Buffer, pipette mix to resuspend the pellet. Depending on the Sample Input, the pellet may resuspend easily or stay as clumps that will take more pipetting to break apart.

Vortex until the Binding Reagent is resuspended, you can briefly centrifuge for 3 sec at 2000xg to collect droplets from the sides of the tube. Note: As the sample contains extracted resuspended RNA, the RT-LAMP reaction should proceed the same day. The extracted samples should not be stored or frozen as it would impact the RNA integrity.
Samples are ready go to Step #25

source.specifications: Any standard mini centrifuge with adapters for different tube sizes will suffice
source.name: Mini-centrifuge

source.description: Prepare the qPCR instrument, have Ice on hand to prepare the master Assay mix. Calculate the amount of samples being run and make sure to include the Positive Control and the H20.
Prepare the Assay mix by adding Reaction Mix and Primer mix according to the amount of samples being run.
Transfer 15ul of Assay mix into the Assay wells.
Transfer 5ul of each sample into the appropriate Assay well, pipette mix.
Add the Positive Control to the Plate or Strip Tube
Transfer 5ul of H20 into the appropriate Negative Control well.

Seal the plate and run it in the qPCR instrument with the method:
Capture 2 Channels:
FAM - No Quencer = Assay Target
Cy3 - No Quencher = Control Target
and Capture Image
Repeat 80x
Thaw the lysis Buffer on ice 1 to 3 hours before starting the experiment. It is recommended to aliquot the lysis buffer in small volumes and use it as needed to avoid excessive freeze-thawing cycles.

If using a Heat Block or water bath proceed to step 4. If using a thermal cycler proceed to step 9.
If following the full method/sample purification proceed to step 12.

Carefully transfer the tubes to ice or a 4°C cold block for 30 sec, or let sit at Room Temperature for 5 min.
4 °C
Or
Room temperature
Centrifuge the tubes for 3 sec at 2000xg to spin down any condensation using a benchtop mini centrifuge. Samples are ready for the RT-LAMP reaction. Proceed to step 26.

source.specifications: Any standard mini centrifuge with adapters for different tube sizes will suffice
source.name: Mini-centrifuge

SAMPLES PREPARATION FOR INCUBATION IN A THERMAL CYCLER
Transfer 20ul of the sample input material (or clarified supernatant if Fresh Saliva) to a new 200 μL tube containing an equal volume of lysis buffer (e.g. for 20 μL of sample add 20 μL of lysis buffer). Mix the obtained solution a few times by pipetting up and down. Label the tube with sample ID and other relevant information.

source.description: Centrifuge the tubes for 3 sec at 2000xg to spin down any condensation using a benchtop mini centrifuge. Samples are ready for the RT-LAMP reaction. Proceed to step 26.

Let the Tubes sit at Room Temperature for 10 min, every 2 min invert the tube to suspend the Binding Solution.
at

Centrifuge for 3 sec at 2000xg to pellet the Binding Reagent in the Binding Solution.
Note: A white smear at the bottom of the tube should be present. The Binding Reagent should adhere to the bottom of the tube with a short spin on a simple benchtop centrifuge. Depending on tube type and input sample viscosity, a longer spin may be required until it is sufficiently pelleted.

source.specifications: Any standard mini centrifuge with adapters for different tube sizes will suffice

source.description: Remove the supernatant with a 1ml Pipette taking care not to disturb the pellet.
Centrifuge for 3 sec at 2000xg to collect any residual Wash Solution.

source.name: Mini-centrifuge

source.description: Remove the residual supernatant with a 200ul Pipette taking care not to disturb the pellet.

Air dry in a clean ventilated area until the Binding Reagent is dry, it should appear opaque and not reflective, air drying should take 10-15 min, some sample types may take longer to dry, do not let drying take longer than 30 min.
Note: If the lab is equipped, air drying should take place in a ventilated air cabinet to prevent cross-contamination. To speed up the air drying, if available it is possible to use a Centrifuge with open tube lids, or a heated vacuum concentrator. If using these it would take less than 15 minutes as it should be evaporating less than 5-10ul of Wash Solution.

To each tube add 10ul of Resuspension Buffer, pipette mix to resuspend the pellet. Depending on the Sample Input, the pellet may resuspend easily or stay as clumps that will take more pipetting to break apart.

Prepare the Real-time PCR instrument, and work on ice for the following steps. Calculate the number of samples being run and make sure to include a positive control and the assay negative control (water only).

source.specifications:
4 excitation filters (450–600 nm)
4 emission filters (500–640 nm)
source.name: QuantStudio 3 Real-Time PCR System

source.description: Prepare the Assay mix by adding Reaction Mix and Primer mix according to the number of samples being run.
Transfer 15ul of Assay mix into the Assay wells.
Transfer 5ul of each sample into the appropriate Assay well, pipette mix.
Add the Positive Control to the Plate or Strip Tube.
Transfer 5ul of UltraPure Distilled water into the appropriate Negative Control well.

Seal the plate and run it in the Real-Time PCR instrument with the following settings :
Channels and Dye
FAM - No Quencer = Assay Target
Cy3 - No Quencher = Control Target
PCR STAGE
for 80 Cycles
Reaction Volume 20 ul
Be sure that the capture/collect image option is selected at the end of the temperature stage (usually a small icon showing a camera should be selected below the temperature settings).

Vortex until the Binding Reagent is resuspended, you can briefly centrifuge for 3 sec at 2000xg to collect droplets from the sides of the tube.
Note: As the sample contains extracted resuspended RNA, the RT-LAMP reaction should proceed the same day. The extracted samples should not be stored or frozen as it would impact the RNA integrity.

source.specifications: Any standard mini centrifuge with adapters for different tube sizes will suffice
